body: @bertrandgauthier can you please provide at least a sample script using DBAL that reproduces the error?

I has this problem

For example, log of error stack when I try to login in site:

> in vendor\doctrine\dbal\lib\Doctrine\DBAL\Driver\OCI8\OCI8Statement.php at line 196   + 
> at OCI8Statement ->closeCursor () 
> in vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\Internal\Hydration\AbstractHydrator.php at line 207   + 
> at AbstractHydrator ->cleanup () 
> in vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\Internal\Hydration\SimpleObjectHydrator.php at line 55   + 
> at SimpleObjectHydrator ->cleanup () 
> in vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\Internal\Hydration\AbstractHydrator.php at line 149   + 
> at AbstractHydrator ->hydrateAll (object(OCI8Statement), object(ResultSetMapping), array()) 
> in vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\Persisters\Entity\BasicEntityPersister.php at line 720   + 
> at BasicEntityPersister ->load (array('username' => 'user'), null, null, array(), null, 1, null) 
> in vendor\doctrine\orm\lib\Doctrine\ORM\EntityRepository.php at line 196   + 
> at EntityRepository ->findOneBy (array('username' => 'user')) 
> in vendor\symfony\symfony\src\Symfony\Bridge\Doctrine\Security\User\EntityUserProvider.php at line 51   + 
> at EntityUserProvider ->loadUserByUsername ('user') 
> in vendor\symfony\symfony\src\Symfony\Component\Security\Core\User\ChainUserProvider.php at line 49   + 
> at ChainUserProvider ->loadUserByUsername ('user') 
> in vendor\repos\app-bundle\src\Security\ChainAuthenticator.php at line 44   +
I don't use the ORM or symfony/security so I cannot reproduce the example above. Could anyone please put together a code example which I could run to reproduce this?
I cannot reproduce this. The only improvement I see here is to use `oci_cancel()` instead of `while (oci_fetch($this->_sth));` which seems more appropriate and efficient.
@bertrandgauthier can you try to use `oci_cancel($this->_sth)` and see if it works? Then I will send a PR.

With `oci_cancel($this->_sth)`, it's ok, no more warning.

I use in my app the doctrine/doctrine-orm-module for ZF2. I did try to reproduce the warning in a new project with only doctrine/dbal package but i didn't succeed, sorry.

Hello, 

:+1: 

I have the issue with the same module for ZF2. I reproduce the problem on line 195 of OCIStatement.php

Maybe a solution is to write @oci_fetch instead of oci_fetch. My work around is to downgrade dbal version in composer by adding this line : 
"doctrine/dbal": "2.5.10 as 2.5.11",

> `@oci_fetch` 

Urgh, no, let's not use the silencing operator, like, EVER.

As stated above, @deeky666 can't reproduce this, so please try providing a failing test scenario in order to ease working on the issue (we'll hopefully find a good workaround)

Here is my stacktrace : 

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12844647/22685860/3bc5bdd0-ed22-11e6-8c2e-e2126952b8d6.png)

The issue occurs when i call the queryBuilder et using getArrayResult() . The query generated is this one:
SELECT f0_.CONFIG_ID AS CONFIG_ID_0, f0_.CONFIG_NAME AS CONFIG_NAME_1, f0_.CONFIG_PROPERTY AS CONFIG_PROPERTY_2, f0_.CONFIG_VALUE AS CONFIG_VALUE_3, f0_.CONFIG_DEFAULT_VALUE AS CONFIG_DEFAULT_VALUE_4, f0_.CONFIG_MODIF_DATE AS CONFIG_MODIF_DATE_5, f0_.CONFIG_MODIF_USER AS CONFIG_MODIF_USER_6 FROM FO_ADMIN_CONFIG f0_ WHERE (f0_.CONFIG_NAME = ? AND f0_.CONFIG_PROPERTY = ?) OR (f0_.CONFIG_NAME = ? AND f0_.CONFIG_PROPERTY = ?)

thank u in advance.
Yes, but that still needs to be reproduced in our test suite, and it needs to fail against CI in order for us to see what is causing it.

@fayouz thank you for the information. I will try to reproduce this again but it would be awesome if you guys can try to figure out how the statement calls are done in which order. That might help

@Ocramius we will go with `oci_close()` which is much cleaner and the preferred way to do this as soon as we can reproduce it.
